column4: I have Vista installed on my computer, how do I create an Ubuntu partition and have it share the harddrive space (so I could access all files) with the Windows partition?
well you can partition your system and have ubuntu run on one partition and windows on the other, ubuntu will be able to access the windows files
nickrud: would that require them to be in different format, like Windows as an NTFS and Linux on something else, or can I have them both the same so I could browse among the files freely?
ubuntu will be in the ext3 format, now ubuntu can read your windows files but windows can't read them back
